29.fullDescription:
In the function `withdraw()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 0.
There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `Constructor()`.

There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `Constructor()`.
29.name: AccessControlVulnerability

29.fullDescription: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function withdraw(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
29.name: FrontRunningVulnerability

fullDescription.text:
In the function `withdraw()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 0.
There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `Constructor()`.

There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `Constructor()`.
A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function withdraw(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
